text: The Year of the Horse is all about speed and energy. In crypto trading, moving too fast often leads to:
answers: Revenge trading and bigger losses after a bad trade

text: What is front-running in cryptocurrency markets?
answers: Always being the first to sell in a dip
Buying a token before a big announcement goes public
Traders or bots placing orders ahead of large visible trades to profit from price movement

text: Horses run freely. In crypto, the closest thing to freedom for your assets is:
What does KYC stand for on crypto exchanges?
The Horse zodiac loves strength and endurance. In trading, this matches best with:
answers: Building a strong portfolio and sticking to your plan through ups and downs
Trading only during Asian session hours

text: What is a honeypot scam in crypto?
answers: Free airdrops that are actually valuable
A token that looks attractive but you can buy it but never sell it
A liquidity pool with very high rewards

text: Horses are fast and powerful. In crypto charts, a sudden strong upward move is often called:
What is the main risk of using very high leverage (like 100x) in crypto futures?
answers: Getting liquidated quickly on small price moves against you

text: The Year of the Horse encourages bold moves. But in trading, the boldest smart move is often:
answers: Taking profits gradually as price rises

text: What does staking mean in proof-of-stake cryptocurrencies?
answers: Locking up your coins to help secure the network and earn rewards
Trading them on centralized exchanges only

text: Horses hate being trapped. In crypto, feeling trapped most often happens when:
answers: You sell too early and price moons
You buy at the top and price keeps falling
Cleaning your wallet address for privacy
Moving coins between your own wallets
Fake trading volume created by buying and selling to yourself to mislead the market

text: The Horse year brings energy and action. Which trading habit action used most wisely?
answers: Checking charts every 5 minutes all day
Arguing with strangers online about price predictions
Having a clear plan before entering any trade

text: What happens during a capitulation phase in a crypto bear market?
answers: Weak hands sell in panic, often marking the bottom

text: Horses are known for strength and speed together. In crypto success, the best combination is:
answers: Speed only – trade as fast as possible
Discipline and patience – wait for good setups and manage risk well
